text:
This letter is from Paul, chosen by the will of God to be an apostle of Christ Jesus.
I am writing to God’s holy people in Ephesus, who are faithful followers of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: All praise to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly realms because we are united with Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even before he made the world, God loved us and chose us in Christ to be holy and without fault in his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: God decided in advance to adopt us into his own family by bringing us to himself through Jesus Christ. This is what he wanted to do, and it gave him great pleasure.
speaker: Narrator

text: So we praise God for the glorious grace he has poured out on us who belong to his dear Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is so rich in kindness and grace that he purchased our freedom with the blood of his Son and forgave our sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has showered his kindness on us, along with all wisdom and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has now revealed to us his mysterious will regarding Christ—which is to fulfill his own good plan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the plan: At the right time he will bring everything together under the authority of Christ—everything in heaven and on earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Furthermore, because we are united with Christ, we have received an inheritance from God, for he chose us in advance, and he makes everything work out according to his plan.
speaker: Narrator

text: God’s purpose was that we Jews who were the first to trust in Christ would bring praise and glory to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now you Gentiles have also heard the truth, the Good News that God saves you. And when you believed in Christ, he identified you as his own by giving you the Holy Spirit, whom he promised long ago.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Spirit is God’s guarantee that he will give us the inheritance he promised and that he has purchased us to be his own people. He did this so we would praise and glorify him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ever since I first heard of your strong faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for God’s people everywhere,
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not stopped thanking God for you. I pray for you constantly,
speaker: Narrator

text: asking God, the glorious Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, to give you spiritual wisdom and insight so that you might grow in your knowledge of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that your hearts will be flooded with light so that you can understand the confident hope he has given to those he called—his holy people who are his rich and glorious inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: I also pray that you will understand the incredible greatness of God’s power for us who believe him. This is the same mighty power
speaker: Narrator

text: that raised Christ from the dead and seated him in the place of honor at God’s right hand in the heavenly realms.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he is far above any ruler or authority or power or leader or anything else—not only in this world but also in the world to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has put all things under the authority of Christ and has made him head over all things for the benefit of the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the church is his body; it is made full and complete by Christ, who fills all things everywhere with himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once you were dead because of your disobedience and your many sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: You used to live in sin, just like the rest of the world, obeying the devil—the commander of the powers in the unseen world. He is the spirit at work in the hearts of those who refuse to obey God.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of us used to live that way, following the passionate desires and inclinations of our sinful nature. By our very nature we were subject to God’s anger, just like everyone else.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God is so rich in mercy, and he loved us so much,
speaker: Narrator

text: that even though we were dead because of our sins, he gave us life when he raised Christ from the dead. (It is only by God’s grace that you have been saved!)
speaker: Narrator

text: For he raised us from the dead along with Christ and seated us with him in the heavenly realms because we are united with Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: So God can point to us in all future ages as examples of the incredible wealth of his grace and kindness toward us, as shown in all he has done for us who are united with Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: God saved you by his grace when you believed. And you can’t take credit for this; it is a gift from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Salvation is not a reward for the good things we have done, so none of us can boast about it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are God’s masterpiece. He has created us anew in Christ Jesus, so we can do the good things he planned for us long ago.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t forget that you Gentiles used to be outsiders. You were called “uncircumcised heathens” by the Jews, who were proud of their circumcision, even though it affected only their bodies and not their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days you were living apart from Christ. You were excluded from citizenship among the people of Israel, and you did not know the covenant promises God had made to them. You lived in this world without God and without hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now you have been united with Christ Jesus. Once you were far away from God, but now you have been brought near to him through the blood of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Christ himself has brought peace to us. He united Jews and Gentiles into one people when, in his own body on the cross, he broke down the wall of hostility that separated us.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did this by ending the system of law with its commandments and regulations. He made peace between Jews and Gentiles by creating in himself one new people from the two groups.
speaker: Narrator

text: Together as one body, Christ reconciled both groups to God by means of his death on the cross, and our hostility toward each other was put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought this Good News of peace to you Gentiles who were far away from him, and peace to the Jews who were near.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now all of us can come to the Father through the same Holy Spirit because of what Christ has done for us.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now you Gentiles are no longer strangers and foreigners. You are citizens along with all of God’s holy people. You are members of God’s family.
speaker: Narrator

text: Together, we are his house, built on the foundation of the apostles and the prophets. And the cornerstone is Christ Jesus himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are carefully joined together in him, becoming a holy temple for the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Through him you Gentiles are also being made part of this dwelling where God lives by his Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I think of all this, I, Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus for the benefit of you Gentiles . . .
speaker: Narrator

text: assuming, by the way, that you know God gave me the special responsibility of extending his grace to you Gentiles.
speaker: Narrator

text: As I briefly wrote earlier, God himself revealed his mysterious plan to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: As you read what I have written, you will understand my insight into this plan regarding Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: God did not reveal it to previous generations, but now by his Spirit he has revealed it to his holy apostles and prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is God’s plan: Both Gentiles and Jews who believe the Good News share equally in the riches inherited by God’s children. Both are part of the same body, and both enjoy the promise of blessings because they belong to Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: By God’s grace and mighty power, I have been given the privilege of serving him by spreading this Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: Though I am the least deserving of all God’s people, he graciously gave me the privilege of telling the Gentiles about the endless treasures available to them in Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was chosen to explain to everyone this mysterious plan that God, the Creator of all things, had kept secret from the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: God’s purpose in all this was to use the church to display his wisdom in its rich variety to all the unseen rulers and authorities in the heavenly places.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was his eternal plan, which he carried out through Christ Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of Christ and our faith in him, we can now come boldly and confidently into God’s presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: So please don’t lose heart because of my trials here. I am suffering for you, so you should feel honored.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I think of all this, I fall to my knees and pray to the Father,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Creator of everything in heaven and on earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that from his glorious, unlimited resources he will empower you with inner strength through his Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Christ will make his home in your hearts as you trust in him. Your roots will grow down into God’s love and keep you strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: And may you have the power to understand, as all God’s people should, how wide, how long, how high, and how deep his love is.
speaker: Narrator

text: May you experience the love of Christ, though it is too great to understand fully. Then you will be made complete with all the fullness of life and power that comes from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now all glory to God, who is able, through his mighty power at work within us, to accomplish infinitely more than we might ask or think.
speaker: Narrator

text: Glory to him in the church and in Christ Jesus through all generations forever and ever! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I, a prisoner for serving the Lord, beg you to lead a life worthy of your calling, for you have been called by God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Always be humble and gentle. Be patient with each other, making allowance for each other’s faults because of your love.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make every effort to keep yourselves united in the Spirit, binding yourselves together with peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: For there is one body and one Spirit, just as you have been called to one glorious hope for the future.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is one Lord, one faith, one baptism,
speaker: Narrator

text:
one God and Father of all,
who is over all, in all, and living through all.
speaker: Narrator

text: However, he has given each one of us a special gift through the generosity of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text:
That is why the Scriptures say, 
“When he ascended to the heights,
    he led a crowd of captives
    and gave gifts to his people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Notice that it says “he ascended.” This clearly means that Christ also descended to our lowly world.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the same one who descended is the one who ascended higher than all the heavens, so that he might fill the entire universe with himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now these are the gifts Christ gave to the church: the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, and the pastors and teachers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their responsibility is to equip God’s people to do his work and build up the church, the body of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will continue until we all come to such unity in our faith and knowledge of God’s Son that we will be mature in the Lord, measuring up to the full and complete standard of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we will no longer be immature like children. We won’t be tossed and blown about by every wind of new teaching. We will not be influenced when people try to trick us with lies so clever they sound like the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, we will speak the truth in love, growing in every way more and more like Christ, who is the head of his body, the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: He makes the whole body fit together perfectly. As each part does its own special work, it helps the other parts grow, so that the whole body is healthy and growing and full of love.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the Lord’s authority I say this: Live no longer as the Gentiles do, for they are hopelessly confused.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their minds are full of darkness; they wander far from the life God gives because they have closed their minds and hardened their hearts against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They have no sense of shame. They live for lustful pleasure and eagerly practice every kind of impurity.
speaker: Narrator

text: But that isn’t what you learned about Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since you have heard about Jesus and have learned the truth that comes from him,
speaker: Narrator

text: throw off your old sinful nature and your former way of life, which is corrupted by lust and deception.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, let the Spirit renew your thoughts and attitudes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put on your new nature, created to be like God—truly righteous and holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: So stop telling lies. Let us tell our neighbors the truth, for we are all parts of the same body.
speaker: Narrator

text: And “don’t sin by letting anger control you.” Don’t let the sun go down while you are still angry,
speaker: Narrator

text: for anger gives a foothold to the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you are a thief, quit stealing. Instead, use your hands for good hard work, and then give generously to others in need.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t use foul or abusive language. Let everything you say be good and helpful, so that your words will be an encouragement to those who hear them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And do not bring sorrow to God’s Holy Spirit by the way you live. Remember, he has identified you as his own, guaranteeing that you will be saved on the day of redemption.
speaker: Narrator

text: Get rid of all bitterness, rage, anger, harsh words, and slander, as well as all types of evil behavior.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, be kind to each other, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, just as God through Christ has forgiven you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Imitate God, therefore, in everything you do, because you are his dear children.
speaker: Narrator

text: Live a life filled with love, following the example of Christ. He loved us and offered himself as a sacrifice for us, a pleasing aroma to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let there be no sexual immorality, impurity, or greed among you. Such sins have no place among God’s people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Obscene stories, foolish talk, and coarse jokes—these are not for you. Instead, let there be thankfulness to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You can be sure that no immoral, impure, or greedy person will inherit the Kingdom of Christ and of God. For a greedy person is an idolater, worshiping the things of this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t be fooled by those who try to excuse these sins, for the anger of God will fall on all who disobey him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t participate in the things these people do.
speaker: Narrator

text: For once you were full of darkness, but now you have light from the Lord. So live as people of light!
speaker: Narrator

text: For this light within you produces only what is good and right and true.
speaker: Narrator

text: Carefully determine what pleases the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take no part in the worthless deeds of evil and darkness; instead, expose them.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is shameful even to talk about the things that ungodly people do in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: But their evil intentions will be exposed when the light shines on them,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for the light makes everything visible. This is why it is said, 
“Awake, O sleeper,
    rise up from the dead,
    and Christ will give you light.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So be careful how you live. Don’t live like fools, but like those who are wise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make the most of every opportunity in these evil days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t act thoughtlessly, but understand what the Lord wants you to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t be drunk with wine, because that will ruin your life. Instead, be filled with the Holy Spirit,
speaker: Narrator

text: singing psalms and hymns and spiritual songs among yourselves, and making music to the Lord in your hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: And give thanks for everything to God the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And further, submit to one another out of reverence for Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: For wives, this means submit to your husbands as to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a husband is the head of his wife as Christ is the head of the church. He is the Savior of his body, the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the church submits to Christ, so you wives should submit to your husbands in everything.
speaker: Narrator

text: For husbands, this means love your wives, just as Christ loved the church. He gave up his life for her
speaker: Narrator

text: to make her holy and clean, washed by the cleansing of God’s word.
speaker: Narrator

text: He did this to present her to himself as a glorious church without a spot or wrinkle or any other blemish. Instead, she will be holy and without fault.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the same way, husbands ought to love their wives as they love their own bodies. For a man who loves his wife actually shows love for himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one hates his own body but feeds and cares for it, just as Christ cares for the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: And we are members of his body.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Scriptures say, “A man leaves his father and mother and is joined to his wife, and the two are united into one.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a great mystery, but it is an illustration of the way Christ and the church are one.
speaker: Narrator

text: So again I say, each man must love his wife as he loves himself, and the wife must respect her husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: Children, obey your parents because you belong to the Lord, for this is the right thing to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Honor your father and mother.” This is the first commandment with a promise:
speaker: Narrator

text: If you honor your father and mother, “things will go well for you, and you will have a long life on the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Fathers, do not provoke your children to anger by the way you treat them. Rather, bring them up with the discipline and instruction that comes from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Slaves, obey your earthly masters with deep respect and fear. Serve them sincerely as you would serve Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Try to please them all the time, not just when they are watching you. As slaves of Christ, do the will of God with all your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Work with enthusiasm, as though you were working for the Lord rather than for people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember that the Lord will reward each one of us for the good we do, whether we are slaves or free.
speaker: Narrator

text: Masters, treat your slaves in the same way. Don’t threaten them; remember, you both have the same Master in heaven, and he has no favorites.
speaker: Narrator

text: A final word: Be strong in the Lord and in his mighty power.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put on all of God’s armor so that you will be able to stand firm against all strategies of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we are not fighting against flesh-and-blood enemies, but against evil rulers and authorities of the unseen world, against mighty powers in this dark world, and against evil spirits in the heavenly places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, put on every piece of God’s armor so you will be able to resist the enemy in the time of evil. Then after the battle you will still be standing firm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stand your ground, putting on the belt of truth and the body armor of God’s righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text: For shoes, put on the peace that comes from the Good News so that you will be fully prepared.
speaker: Narrator

text: In addition to all of these, hold up the shield of faith to stop the fiery arrows of the devil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put on salvation as your helmet, and take the sword of the Spirit, which is the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pray in the Spirit at all times and on every occasion. Stay alert and be persistent in your prayers for all believers everywhere.
speaker: Narrator

text: And pray for me, too. Ask God to give me the right words so I can boldly explain God’s mysterious plan that the Good News is for Jews and Gentiles alike.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am in chains now, still preaching this message as God’s ambassador. So pray that I will keep on speaking boldly for him, as I should.
speaker: Narrator

text: To bring you up to date, Tychicus will give you a full report about what I am doing and how I am getting along. He is a beloved brother and faithful helper in the Lord’s work.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sent him to you for this very purpose—to let you know how we are doing and to encourage you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peace be with you, dear brothers and sisters, and may God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you love with faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator

text: May God’s grace be eternally upon all who love our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator
